purpleculture_examples:

purpleculture_tree:
• ⿹ Surround from upper right

heisig_chinese_memo: As crows are birds which are all black, it's hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be.
heisig_constituent: crow, drop, mouth, one, tail feathers
heisig_story: The only thing that distinguishes this character from that for bird is the omission of the one stroke that makes it white. Which is logical enough, when you consider that there are no crows of that color.
koohiiStory1: The book´s story is just fine, but I found a kanji dictionary explanation also interesting: As crows are all black, it´s hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be.
koohiiStory2: A crow is a bird, but not a white one. MEANING: write bird, but skip writing one in white.
kunYomi: からす、いずくんぞ、なんぞ
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: An altered bird is a crow! They look like birds but they're bigger and darker and smarter!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: See that bird? Wait, that's not just a bird, it's a crow!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you can't tell just from looking at it that it's a crow and not a bird, walk up to it and caress (からす) it with your hand! If it caresses you back, it's a crow! If it freaks out and flies away or pecks your face, it's a normal bird. Crows are really smart and like affection. That's what makes them so cool!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: How many crows have you caressed today?
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 鳥 (とり、チョウ птица), 嗚 (ああ、ウ、オ звук плача, звук "А").
Ru_trainchinese:
wū: (графема) ворон; черный
wū: (местоим) (книжн., используется в риторических вопросах) как, разве
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the bird (鳥) that's not white (白) is a crow
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This crow is a bird which is missing his beak.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The name of the bird, that is, the crow. "Said Wen": "Wu, filial piety bird. Pictogram. Confucius said: "Wu, 𥃳 Hu also." Take it to help breath, so I think that Wu Hu. Every wu belongs to Wu. 𤚶, ancient Chinese Wu, pictogram. Yu, like the ancient Chinese province of Wu." The ancients believed that crows were grateful for their relatives and could feed back, so they were called filial birds. Bai Juyi's "Ciwu Night Cry" called it "Zeng Shen among the Birds". See also " Xiao ".

" Wu " is not seen in the oracle bone inscriptions. An important feature of the inscription " Wu " is that the mouth opens upwards. This is because the crows are good at feeding back. The female crow opens its mouth and spit out the food that has been swallowed in the body to feed the little crow. In addition, most of the glyphs are in the shape of a bird without eyes, and the crow is completely black without seeing the eyes. Duan Yucai's explanation is: "The word "bird" is the finishing touch, but the word "Wu" is not. It is pure black, so you can't see the eye." But there are also some examples of writing that can be determined as " Wu " with eyes drawn, such as Mao Gongding. Bronze inscription was used as a modal particle, and it was first seen in the early Western Zhou Dynasty, and it was gradually written as " Yu " in the late Western Zhou Dynasty. This is " Woo ", see " Yu ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: the name of the bird, that is, the crow. The ancients believed that crows were grateful for their kindness and could feed back, so they were called filial birds.
humanum_full_description:
鳥名，即烏鴉。《說文》：「烏，孝鳥也。象形。孔子曰：『烏，𥃳呼也。』取其助气，故以爲烏呼。凡烏之屬皆从烏。𤚶，古文烏，象形。於，象古文烏省。」古人認為烏鴉感念親恩，好反哺，故名為孝鳥。白居易〈慈烏夜啼〉稱之為「鳥中之曾參」。另參「梟」。

　　「烏」未見甲骨文，金文烏字一個重要特徵是口部向上張開，這是因為烏鴉好反哺，母烏鴉張開嘴巴把已吞進體內的食物吐出來喂小烏鴉。此外，大部分字形作鳥形而沒有眼睛，蓋烏鴉全身烏黑而不見眼睛。段玉裁的解釋是：「『鳥』字點睛，『烏』則不，以純黑故不見其睛也。」但亦有些文例可以確定為「烏」的字有畫出眼睛，如毛公鼎。金文用作語氣詞，始見於西周早期，西周晚期始漸簡寫作「於」。今作「嗚」，參見「於」。
humanum_short_description: 鳥名，即烏鴉。古人認為烏鴉感念親恩，好反哺，故名為孝鳥。

①指“烏鴉”：烏白馬角(喻不可能實現的事情)。烏飛兔走(喻日往月來，時間流逝)。烏合之衆。
②黑色的：烏亮。烏雲。
③無，沒有：化爲烏有。
④文言疑問詞，哪，何：烏足道哉？
⑤古同“嗚”，嗚乎。
⑥姓氏。

鳥名，即烏鴉。《說文》：「烏，孝鳥也。象形。孔子曰：『烏，𥃳呼也。』取其助气，故以爲烏呼。凡烏之屬皆从烏。𤚶，古文烏，象形。於，象古文烏省。」古人認為烏鴉感念親恩，好反哺，故名為孝鳥。白居易〈慈烏夜啼〉稱之為「鳥中之曾參」。另參「 梟 」。 「 烏 」未見甲骨文，金文烏字一個重要特徵是口部向上張開，這是因為烏鴉好反哺，母烏鴉張開嘴巴把已吞進體內的食物吐出來喂小烏鴉。此外，大部分字形作鳥形而沒有眼睛，蓋烏鴉全身烏黑而不見眼睛。段玉裁的解釋是：「『鳥』字點睛，『烏』則不，以純黑故不見其睛也。」但亦有些文例可以確定為「 烏 」的字有畫出眼睛，如毛公鼎。金文用作語氣詞，始見於西周早期，西周晚期始漸簡寫作「 於 」。今作「 嗚 」，參見「 於 」。
Elaboration: The name of the bird, that is, the crow. "Said Wen": "Wu, filial piety bird. Pictogram. Confucius said: "Wu, 𥃳 Hu also." Take it to help breath, so I think that Wu Hu. Every wu belongs to Wu. 𤚶, ancient Chinese Wu, pictogram. Yu, like the ancient Chinese province of Wu." The ancients believed that crows were grateful for their relatives and could feed back, so they were called filial birds. Bai Juyi's "Ciwu Night Cry" called it "Zeng Shen among the Birds". See also " Xiao". " Wu" is not seen in the oracle bone inscriptions. An important feature of the inscription " Wu" is that the mouth opens upwards. This is because the crows are good at feeding back. The female crow opens its mouth and spit out the food that has been swallowed in the body to feed the little crow. In addition, most of the glyphs are in the shape of a bird without eyes, and the crow is completely black without seeing the eyes. Duan Yucai's explanation is: "The word "bird" is the finishing touch, but the word "Wu" is not. It is pure black, so you can't see the eye." But there are also some examples of writing that can be determined as " Wu" with eyes drawn, such as Mao Gongding. Bronze inscription was used as a modal particle, and it was first seen in the early Western Zhou Dynasty, and it was gradually written as " Yu" in the late Western Zhou Dynasty. This is " Woo", see " Yu".

烏字的基本解释

烏
wū
见“乌”。

烏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wū］
［《廣韻》哀都切，平模，影。］
“乌1”的繁体字。
(1)鸟名。乌鸦。又称“老鴰”、“老鴉”。羽毛通体或大部分黑色。
(2)黑色。
(3)指抹黑，染黑。
(4)古代神话传说太阳中有三足乌，因以“乌”为太阳的代称。
(5)疑问副词。何，哪里。
(6)叹词。同“嗚”。参见“烏乎”。
(7)通“”。吐出。
(8)姓。春秋齐有乌枝鸣。见《左传·昭公二十一年》。
[②]［yā］
［《集韻》於加切，平麻，影。］
“乌2”的繁体字。
地名用字。
[③]［wù］
“乌3”的繁体字。
见“烏3拉”、“烏3拉草”。

烏字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　烏； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页670第01
〔古文〕?於?【唐韻】哀都切【集韻】【正韻】汪胡切，?音污。【說文】孝鳥也。象形。【埤雅】林罕以爲全象鳥形，但不注其目睛。烏體全黑，遠而不分別其睛也。【詩·邶風】莫黑匪烏。【小爾雅】純黑而反哺者謂之烏。　又【前漢·眭弘傳】石立，後有白烏數千，下集其旁。　又【爾雅·釋鳥】燕白脰烏。【註】小爾雅云：白項而羣飛者，謂之燕烏。【又】鸀山烏。　又【周禮·夏官·羅氏】掌羅烏鳥。【註】烏謂?居，鵲之屬。　又【小爾雅】去隂就陽者，謂之陽烏，鴻雁是也。　又【韻會】日中有三足烏。　又【說文】孔子曰：烏?，呼也，取其助气故以爲烏呼。【註】徐鉉曰：俗作嗚，非是。【埤雅】烏又爲歎詞者，烏見異則噪，故以爲烏霍。烏霍，歎所異也。　又【玉篇】語辭也。又【廣韻】安也。【正韻】何也。【史記·司馬相如傳】烏有先生者，烏有此事也。【註】徐廣曰：烏，一作惡。　又【史記·天官書】聚一十五星，蔚然曰郞位。【註】索隱曰：蔚然，漢書作哀烏，星之狀貌。【正字通】星經作依烏，後人因謂郞官爲依烏府。　

烏字的源字形

字源演变：

金文楷体

字形对比：

暂无。

Basic explanation of words

wū

Wu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wū］
["Guangyun" mourning all cut, flat model, shadow. ]
Traditional characters for "乌1".
(1) The name of the bird. crow. Also known as "Old Raven" and "Old Crow". The feathers are whole or mostly black.
(2) Black.
(3) Refers to slander and black.
(4) In ancient myths, there are three-legged black crow in the sun, because "black" is the synonym for the sun.
(5) Interrogative adverbs. What, where.
(6) Interjection. Same as "Woo". See "Wuhu".
(7) Pass "". Spit out.
(8) Last name. There are Wuzhiming in Spring and Autumn. See "Twenty-one Years of Zuo Zhuan · Zhao Gong".
[②]［yā］
["Ji Yun" Yu Jiaqie, Ping Ma, Ying. ]
Traditional characters for "乌2".
Place names in words.
[③]［wù］
Traditional characters for "乌3".
See "Wu 3 La", "Wu 3 La Cao".

Radicals: 鳥  (bird)
Meaning Mnemonic
An altered bird is a crow! They look like birds but they're bigger and darker and smarter!
See that bird? Wait, that's not just a bird, it's a crow!
Reading Mnemonic
If you can't tell just from looking at it that it's a crow and not a bird, walk up to it and caress (からす) it with your hand! If it caresses you back, it's a crow! If it freaks out and flies away or pecks your face, it's a normal bird. Crows are really smart and like affection. That's what makes them so cool!
How many crows have you caressed today?
